Description: Patient-derived models, such as xenografts and organoids, are increasingly used as high-fidelity preclinical models in cancer research. This session will start with a short introduction of common patient-derived models used in cancer research, and then focus on the relevance of such models in the era of immune oncology. The overarching goal of the session is to explore the strengths and opportunities of state-of-the-art in vivo and in vitro patient-derived models, while specifically addressing tumor-immune interactions. The challenges, limitations, and future goals for each system will also be discussed.
SearchResultBody: FO09. What Is the Utility of PDX and Organoid Models in the Era of Immuno-oncology?
Title: What Is the Utility of PDX and Organoid Models in the Era of Immuno-oncology?
